title: 100 Followers Problem
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large \\sum_{k=1}^{35} \\sin \\left(5k^\\circ \\right) = \\tan \\left(\\frac {m}{n}\\right)^\\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The equation above holds true for coprime positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac {m}{n} < 90"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} S & = \sum_{k=1}^{35} \sin \left(5k^\circ \right) & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{By Euler's formula: }e^{xi} = \cos x + i \sin x \\ & = \sum_{k=1}^{35} \Im \left[e^{5k^\circ i}\right] & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{where } \Im(z) \text{ is the imaginary part of }z. \\ & = \Im \left[\sum_{k=1}^{35} e^{5k^\circ i}\right] & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Summation of geometric progression} \\ & = \Im \left[e^{5^\circ i} \left( \frac {1-e^{175^\circ i}}{1-e^{5^\circ i}} \right) \right] \\ & = \Im \left[ \frac {e^{5^\circ i}-e^{180^\circ i}}{1-e^{5^\circ i}} \right] \\ & = \Im \left[ \frac {e^{5^\circ i}+1}{1-e^{5^\circ i}} \right] \\ & = \Im \left[ \frac {1+\cos 5^\circ + i \sin 5^\circ}{1-\cos 5^\circ - i \sin 5^\circ} \right] & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Multiply up and down with }1-\cos 5^\circ + i \sin 5^\circ \\ & = \Im \left[ \frac {2i \sin 5^\circ}{2-2\cos 5^\circ} \right] \\ & = \frac {\sin 5^\circ}{1-\cos 5^\circ} \\ & = \frac {2\sin 2.5^\circ \cos 2.5^\circ}{1-1 +2\sin^2 2.5^\circ} \\ & = \cot \frac {5^\circ}2 = \tan \frac {175^\circ}2 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a+b = 175+2 = \boxed{177}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"References:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Euler's formula","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Geometric progression","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

Instead of using the half-angle tangent substitution, maybe it is easier to put "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sin(5^o) = 2 \sin(2.5^o) \cos(2.5^o) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \cos(5^o) = 1 - 2 \sin^2(2.5^o) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

                                            Also, when you multply below and above by the conjugate, the result is the imaginary part of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac{2i \sin(5^o)}{2 - 2 \cos(5^o)} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". There is no "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1 - \cos^2(5^o) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" above.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 100 Follower Problem! Algebra
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \\neq 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be an integer. Find the number of polynomials "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with real coeﬃcients such that, for real "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\Large{\\left( { x }^{ 3 }-m{ x }^{ 2 }+1 \\right) p\\left( x+1 \\right) +\\left( { x }^{ 3 }+m{ x }^{ 2 }+1 \\right) p\\left( x-1 \\right) =2\\left( { x }^{ 3 }-m{ x }^{ 2 }+1 \\right) p\\left( x \\right) }."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

title: 100 Followers Problem (Calculus)!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n \ln{\left[\left(1+\frac{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}{n}\right)^{\cos\theta} \left(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}\right)^{\cot\theta} \left(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}\right)^{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}\right]}d\theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose the value of the above limit can be expressed in the form: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln\left({\frac{(\sqrt{A} + 1)^B}{\sqrt{C}}}\right) +\left(\frac{1}{D} - \frac{1}{\sqrt{E}}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A,B,C,D,E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A,C,E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are square free.
Then what is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A+B+C+D+E "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/9LR6eXv28Q-a-theorem.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First of all, understand what the above theorem says. It's very simple to understand, for those who don't know it, and I expect a lot of people to know it."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Denote "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = \left(1+\frac{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}{n}\right)^{\cos\theta} , Q=\left(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}\right)^{\cot\theta}, R=\left(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}\right)^{\sin\theta\sec^2\theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus we have the integral as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{[PQR]}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta+ \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(Q)} \ d\theta+ \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}  \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty}  n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\sec\theta \tan\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\sec\theta}{n}}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{\tan\theta\ln{(1+\frac{\sec\theta \tan\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\sec\theta\tan\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \tan\theta \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \cot\theta\cos\theta\frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\cos\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\cos\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \cot\theta\cos\theta \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3}\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \sec\theta\frac{\ln{(1+\frac{\cot\theta}{n}})}{\frac{\cot\theta}{n}}\ d\theta = \displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \sec\theta \ d\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore we obtain:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(P)}\ d\theta +\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(Q)}\ d\theta+ \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} n\ln{(R)}\ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\displaystyle \int_{\pi/4}^{\pi/3} \left(\tan\theta + \cot\theta\cos\theta + \sec\theta \right) \ d\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And solving this elementary definite integral gives us the value:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ln\left({\frac{(\sqrt{3} + 1)^2}{\sqrt{6}}}\right) +\left(\frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{A+B+C+D+E = \boxed{15}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"too easy ! "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle{I=\int _{ \cfrac { -\pi  }{ 4 }  }^{ n\pi -\cfrac { \pi  }{ 4 }  }{ \left| \sqrt { 2 } \sin { (x+\cfrac { \pi  }{ 4 } ) }  \right|  } dx\\ I=\sqrt { 2 } \int _{ 0 }^{ n\pi  }{ \left| \sin { t }  \right|  } dt=\sqrt { 2 } n\int _{ 0 }^{ \pi  }{ \left| \sin { t }  \right| dt } \\ I=2\sqrt { 2 } n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" P = \\tan \\dfrac \\theta2 + 2\\tan \\theta + 4\\tan2\\theta + 8\\cot4\\theta "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and given that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\dfrac1{1- \\cos\\theta + i \\sin\\theta} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed in the form of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a + bi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are real numbers with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i = \\sqrt{-1} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Compute "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\dfrac{a\\cdot b}{ P } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = \tan{\dfrac{\theta}{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We can use the double-angle formula to get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{(\theta)} = \dfrac{2x}{1-x^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Applying the formula again and simplifying, we get: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan{(2\theta)} = \dfrac{4x(1-x^2)}{1-6x^2+x^4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":". If we apply the formula one more time and take the reciprocal, we get: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cot{(4\theta)} = \dfrac{1}{\tan{(4\theta)}} = \dfrac{(1-6x^2+x^4)^2-16x^2(1-x^2)^2}{8x(1-x^2)(1-6x^4+x^4)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = x + \dfrac{4x}{1-x^2} + \dfrac{16x(1-x^2)}{1-6x^2+x^4} + \dfrac{(1-6x^2+x^4)^2-16x^2(1-x^2)^2}{x(1-x^2)(1-6x^4+x^4)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
After some simplifying, the result is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = \dfrac{1}{x} = \cot{\dfrac{\theta}{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now onto the second part of the problem:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{1-\cos(\theta)+ i \sin(\theta)} = \dfrac{1-\cos(\theta) - i \sin(\theta)}{(1-\cos(\theta))^2 + \sin^2(\theta)} = \dfrac{1-\cos(\theta) - i \sin(\theta)}{2 - 2\cos(\theta)} = \dfrac{1}{2} - \dfrac{\sin(\theta)}{2 - 2\cos(\theta)} i "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = \dfrac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = - \dfrac{\sin(\theta)}{2 - 2\cos(\theta)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Substitute "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin(\theta) = 2\sin\dfrac{\theta}{2} \cos\dfrac{\theta}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\cos(\theta) = 1 - 2\sin^2\dfrac{\theta}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b = - \dfrac{2\sin\dfrac{\theta}{2} \cos\dfrac{\theta}{2}}{4\sin^2\dfrac{\theta}{2}} = - \dfrac{1}{2}\cot\dfrac{\theta}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{a*b}{P} = \dfrac{1}{2} * \left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\cot\dfrac{\theta}{2}\right) ÷ \cot{\dfrac{\theta}{2}} = \boxed{\dfrac{-1}{4}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 100 Followers!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the set of all continuous, real-valued functions which are solutions to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" [f(x)]^2 = \int_{0}^{x} [f(t)f'(t)-f(t)-f'(t)-1] dt + 100 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Evaluate: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \frac{1}{|F|}\sum_{f(x) \in F} |f(100)| "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|S|"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denotes the "},{"type":"text","text":"cardinality","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Two functions are equal if and only if they share a point and their derivatives are equal. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying this principle, we check that the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"LHS"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the same as the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"RHS"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" [f(0)]^{2} = \int_{0}^{0} [f(t)f'(t)-f(t)-f'(t)-1] dt + 100 = 100"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0)=\pm 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, checking that their derivatives are equal:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2f(x)f'(x) = f(x)f'(x)-f(x)-f'(x)-1 \Rightarrow [f(x)+1][f'(x)+1]=0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f'(x)=-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=-1, c_{1}-x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using what we know about "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we reject "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and get that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c_{1}=\pm 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We end up with:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = 10-x, \quad  f(x)=-10-x"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|F|=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and our sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}(90+110)=\boxed{100}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can also reject all piecewise functions consisting of a combination of these three functions, since combining the constant function with any of the other linear functions will result in a function that is not differentiable at some point. Also, combining the two non-constant functions will cause the resulting function to be discontinuous"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f(x) \; = \; \left\{ \begin{array}{lll} 10-x & \hspace{1cm} & x < 11 \\ -1 & & x \ge 11 \end{array} \right. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
fail because of lack of differentiability (at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in this case).
